title: So My Friend Was In A Bible Study And It Was About A Fish Who Ate Jonah
body: The minister asked if anyone knew who the fish was, my friend said {{champion:223}} . It so happened the minister played LoL, he laughed his ass off.

replies.body: Jonah is the gambler confirmed
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jj4nJ1YEAp4
thank you for this.
The Bible actually calls it "a great fish" if I remember correctly.

Indeed, but what makes things more complicated is that the classification of animals was far less diverse back then, so whales would be considered fish. It wasn't until far later that the word "fish" stopped being a generic word for an aquatic creature, and started to refer to a scientific classification. Animals were pretty much split as follows: Fish in the sea, beasts of the earth, birds in the sky, and creatures that moved across the ground.
Username checks out.
He's actually the one who ate Jonah.

Laughing Fish has been {{champion:223}} this whole time?

This explains a lot actually
My computer must not be working properly; it doesn't show a gif in Laughing Fish's comment, but there's no way that's really the case.
Speaking of a great fish...

> [{quoted}](name=PartyPanda12,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=e8Xg9VV4,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2016-09-02T15:08:43.803+0000)
>
> The Bible actually calls it "a great fish" if I remember correctly.

The original word used means a great sea creature of an indistinct nature. It could be a whale, or a fish, or something else.
I always imagined it as a surviving Megalodon.
'Twas the Kraken {{champion:420}}
I see someone else has read Kronos.
I actually have not, is is good?
Hhm... Well I like it but I'm not sure if others would, however the Nemesis series of books by the same author are ones I would highly recommend, a real giant monster book series.
Crap.... I guess I have to reread the old testament.

Fun fact.  When we make champs we make "mood boards," basically huge photoshop images with dozens and dozens of references.  This is so we can prove out that the imagery, personality, and theme will subconsciously make sense and resonate with players.   This and Leviathan were on the board (along with kappas, chinese fish demons, and many other things.).   So in a way, your friend was right.

I'd like to see some Kappa's http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/925/494/218.png_large  http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/mythology/images/5/52/Kappa-shi1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20131213015429

Reminds me of when I was a kid and asked my Pastor why do people think all demons are bad.  He replied, that they're all monsters looking to devour our souls. I said. "Not Master Chief!". He smiled and said, no Master Chief certainly isn't a bad demon. 

Looking back at it just lets me know that he was probably one of the coolest pastors ever.

Also The Arbiter is the shit as well.
